attributes.action: Is it time to dissolve Parliament and hold a General Election?
attributes.additional_details: The referendum is a consultation tool that helps to inform policy. There is no legal requirement to enact the results but having heard the voice of the British people and seen the political fallout, which will only get worse if nothing is done to stem the flow of tidal disorder, is it now the right time to call for a general election? I believe it is. All parties can then canvass the Brish electorate on the actual details of how to enact the results of the referendum on the EU.
attributes.background: The E.U. Referendum asked  for voters views  on whether they would like to leave the EU. The referendum  did not ask or stipulate  how or when the U.K. should leave the E.U.
